info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 3:04AM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible with isolated higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 10 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
